units.title: Culture organoids
units.text: 1 Culture organoids (or organoid co-cultures) in 50 µl of Matrigel and 200 µl of medium in a standard 96-well tissue culture plate.
units.rationale: Establishes the starting organoid cultures for the workflow.

units.title: S phase cell labeling
units.text:
S phase cell labeling ● Timing ~30 min
2 Add 127IdU directly to culture medium to a ﬁnal concentration of 25 µM (10 µl of 0.5 mM stock added to 200 µl of medium). Gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s to mix the medium and incubate the plate for 25 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Labels proliferating cells to identify S‑phase populations.

units.title: Phosphatase and protease inhibitor treatment
units.text:
Phosphatase and protease inhibitor treatment ● Timing ~5 min
3 Add the protease inhibitor cocktail (100× stock; see Reagents) and PhosSTOP (40× stock; see Reagents) directly to culture medium, gently rotate the plate by hand ﬁve times for 10 s and incubate for 5 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Preserves signaling proteins and PTMs during fixation.

units.title: Fixation
units.text:
Fixation ● Timing ~80 min
4 Remove culture medium by pipetting. Add 200 µl of prewarmed (37 °C) 4% (vol/vol) PFA into each well, taking care not to disrupt Matrigel. Incubate for 60 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Stabilizes cellular structures and PTM states in situ.

units.title: Live/dead discrimination
units.text:
Live/dead discrimination ● Timing ~30 min
6 Remove PBS by pipetting. Add 200 µl of 0.25 µM 194cisplatin/PBS solution to each well and incubate for 10–15 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: Marks dead cells to enable their exclusion during analysis.

units.title: TOBis barcoding (optional)
units.text:
TOBis (optional) ● Timing ~30 min of bench work; incubation overnight
8 Transfer 200 µl of pre-aliquoted TOBis barcodes to corresponding organoid samples in a 96-well plate (from Step 7). Any barcode combination can be used to stain any culture condition (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4). Incubate the cells overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Imparts a unique metal barcode to each sample for multiplexed analysis.

units.title: Single‑cell dissociation
units.text:
Single-cell dissociation ● Timing ~90 min
11 Make up a dissociation solution of fresh 0.5 mg/ml dispase II, 0.2 mg/ml collagenase IV and 0.2 mg/ml DNase I in PBS at room temperature.
12 Remove PBS from the wells by pipetting and add the dissociation solution.
13 Scrape Matrigel droplets and pool all cells from all conditions with dissociation solution to a gentleMACS C‑Tube. Top up the dissociation solution to 5 ml/C‑Tube.
14 Dissociate organoids into single cells by using a gentleMACS Octo dissociator and the ‘Standard protocol’ (see Equipment setup) (Timing: ~50 min).
units.rationale: Generates a single‑cell suspension suitable for mass cytometry.

units.title: Extracellular staining
units.text:
Extracellular stain ● Timing ~45 min
21 Centrifuge cells at 800g for 5 min at room temperature, discard the supernatant and resuspend cells in 50 µl of CSB.
22 Prepare extracellular antibody cocktail by mixing the antibody panel (see Supplementary Table 2 for an example) at desired concentrations in CSB (total volume up to 50 µl).
23 Add the extracellular antibody cocktail to the cells, mix thoroughly by pipetting and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
24 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.

units.title: Permeabilization
units.text:
Permeabilization ● Timing ~45 min
25 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of 0.1% (vol/vol) Triton X-100/PBS, gently vortex and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
26 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant. Repeat the wash and remove the supernatant.
27 Place the cells on ice for 1 min.
28 Resuspend cells in 1 ml of ice-cold 50% (vol/vol) methanol/PBS (store at −20 °C until use), gently vortex and incubate for 10 min on ice.
29 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant. Repeat the wash.
30 Resuspend cells in 50 µl of CSB.
units.rationale: Permeabilizes membranes to allow intracellular antibody access.

units.title: Intracellular staining
units.text:
Intracellular stain ● Timing ~45 min
31 Prepare intracellular antibody cocktail by mixing the antibody panel (see Supplementary Table 2 for an example) at desired concentrations in CSB (total volume up to 50 µl).
32 Add the intracellular antibody cocktail to the cells, mix thoroughly by pipetting and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
33 Add 2 ml of CSB to the cells, centrifuge at 800g for 5 min at room temperature and discard the supernatant.
units.rationale: Detects intracellular PTMs and cell‑state markers before data acquisition.
